Author: Daniel Tonon
Message:
Fix for #1333 - No warnings when grid is turned off; Also added a subgrid warning (#1334)

* Fix #1333 - /* autoprefixer grid: off */ will not output grid warnings

* Adding test for #1333 (preventing warnings when grid is turned off)

* Adding "npx" to "gulp play" command in playground CSS comment

Not everyone has Gulp installed globally.
This prevents people who don't have Gulp installed globally getting confused why "gulp play" doesn't work.

* Triggering a warning if "subgrid" is used for any CSS value

IE does not support subgrid and Autoprefixer can't polyfill subgrid either.

* Updating tests to include subgrid warning

Co-authored-by: Daniel Tonon <dan503.npm@gmail.com>

Author: Daniel Tonon
Message:
Gulp 4 code fixes (#1173)

* Replacing `path.join()` with a `join()` function

`path.join()` doesn't always work properly in Gulp 4. It is safer to use this simple `join()` function.

let join = (...folderPath) => folderPath.join('/')

* Gulp 4 code improvements

- It now runs 'build:lib', 'build:docs', 'build:bin', 'build:package' all in parallel rather than one after the other

- replaced old `gulp.start()` commands with propper `gulp.series()` syntax

- Fixed the "watch-playground" gulp task syntax

Fixed enabling autoplacement in old projects section recommendation (#1163)

Author: Bogdan Dolin
Message:
[css-grid] Implement autoplacement (#1148) (#1151)

* [css-grid] Implement Autoplacement feature

* [css-grid] Add test cases for autoplacement

* [css-grid] fix grid-template-rows/columns values

* [css-grid] add support for 'grid-auto-flow' property in autoplacement

* [refactor] move part of functionality to grid-rows-columns hack

* [css-grid] Add test cases for grid-auto-flow and for rows warning

* update size limit

* [css-grid] Comment out grid-auto-flow warning (at least for now)

* [css-grid] Show warning when grid-auto-flow: dense is used

* [css-grid] add FIXME about commented out warning

* update size limit again to make CI pass

* [css-grid] Show grid-auto-flow warning only if grid template is present

* [css-grid] Fix warnings

* [refactor] Add comments

* [css-grid] Add support for grid: 'autoplace'

* [css-grid] Remove the unneeded output

Now as we support grid: 'autoplace' option, autoplacement works only where defined,
so autoplacement won't work in grid-status.css now.

* update size limit value

* [css-grid] Add autoplace conditional comment

* [css-grid] Add test cases with autoplace conditional comments

* [playground] Add support for grid autoplacement

* [refactor] Remove todo comment

* [css-grid] Change autoplace conditional comment and fix test cases

* update size limit value

* update readme.md

* update readme 2

* Adding a table of contents

(install this VS Code extension to easily keep it up to date: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=yzhang.markdown-all-in-one#overview)

* Fixing FAQ heading levels

The TOC wasn't generating correctly because the FAQ heading levels were incorrect

* Grid autoplacement readme updates

* (alias for deprecated value `on`) text in readme

* [css-grid] fix grid areas algorithm

* [css-grid] Add test to check the output for different grid options

* Updating readme with "no-autoplace" grid setting.

* Readme "Do not create `::before` and `::after` pseudo elements" section

* Fixing ::before/::after example in readme

* Removed word "both" (there are 3 items)

* Minor readme fixes

* [css-grid] Add warning when grid-gap is used without template or autoplacement

* [css-grid] fix grid-gap warnings

* update size limit

* Added section about changing the grid-gap value to the Autoplacement guide

* Adding note about the lack of auto-fit and auto-fill support

I think we need to point this out specifically since people will get excited when they here auto-placement support is coming and think _all_ of auto-placement support is coming.

* Fixing inconsistent indentation in Readme

I'm used to having an indent size of 2 spaces. The rest of the readme uses an indent size of 4 spaces though so I've increased any 2 space indents to 4 spaces.

* [css-grid] fix rows/columns values

* [css-grid] Add warning for grid-template-columns property

Author: Daniel Tonon
Message:
[Updated] Add warning to align/justify-items/content in IE (#1129)

* Add waring to align/justify-items in IE

* Split align/justify-items/content to two different warning and also add tips to waring to align/justify-items/content.

* putting the "i" and the "e" the right way around

* Adding missing align-content test

* Making warning message clearer

- Triggers on more than just "display: grid"
- Personalizes the "align/justify-self" suggestion based on what the user entered
- Splits the warning message into multiple lines to make the warning easier to read

* Increase size limit and fix function to arrow

* Fix tests

* Revert "Fix tests"

This reverts commit a353ef6610886861182733744261fd182a3a98b3.

* Attempt at fixing grid test fails

It is still failing for some reason but I think the code is a bit closer to how the code is meant to be.

I also added further personalisation to the warning messages as well in this commit.

* Adding missing warning test

* Removing rouge quote mark from warning

* Theoretically this should fix the last 2 real errors

* Fix for inconsistent warning error

* Fix for "ei" class names

* Deleting align-content test

I'm deleting this test due to an issue in Autoprefixer causing Jest to not act consistently

Details here
https://github.com/postcss/autoprefixer/issues/1127

It isn't as simple as just swapping the values around because Jest expects different things depending on what test is being run.

Author: Bogdan Dolin
Message:
WIP: [grid-area] implement duplicate grid-areas (#1095)

* [grid-area] implement duplicate grid-areas

* Adding tests for #1091 duplicate area names

* small refactoring

* typos in the test case output

* fix typos in the test cases

* remove duplicate selectors

* fix the order of rules (now it is correct order)

* change the selectors

* Implement areas with duplicate selectors

this needs refactoring, but overall it should work fine

* fix incorrect duplicate selectors spawning

* Implement warning if grid-template selector is not found

* Add tests for warning

* remoove unnecessary 'expect' function

* Fix bug when -ms-grid-row/column-span wasn't added

I forgot to fix this in the previous PR, so doing it now :)

* refactor and add comments

* warn user when grid is enabled and display: contents; is used

* fix bug when last similar rule is undefined

* fix areas to be inside @media with grid-template (only if areas above)

* add more test cases

* fix the previous test case (some rules is merged now)

* merge rules inside test case

* add the functionality to allow more rule merging

* remove unnecessary conditions and refactor

* small refactoring

* Remove 'duplicate area names' warning functionality

* Rewrite the implementation of insertArea function

Hack API wasn't enough to implement grid-area rules with 
duplicate area names, so I moved the call of insertAreas
function to processor.js and rewrote it from the start.

* Update stylesheet test cases to fit the new duplicate rules feature

As we have duplicate grid-area rules support, the order of rules is changed now. Before that the pack of duplicate rules with prefixes was inserted after the last grid-area rule, but now each duplicate rule is inserted right after the matched rule.

We also preserve the order of prefixed grid-area rules and merge the rules with the same media parameters

* Change the order of test case with media rules

We should pay attention to this commit, I'm not sure if it's right, but the output order for grid-area rules inside media rule is changed. Can it break something?

* Fix the warning test to match the changed css test case

* Rename duplicate-grid-areas-above -> duplicate-grid-areas-complex

I also added the additional complex test case as Dan showed [here](https://github.com/postcss/autoprefixer/pull/1095#issuecomment-412489115)

* [refactor] add comments for clarity, move the piece of code to a different function

* Change warning message (make it more informative)

* Fix typos

* Fix the bug when not found grid-area identifier crashed the compiler

* Change the warning message a little

* Improve warning function to show warnings only for selectors with duplicate area names

* Change warning message

* Add more test cases

* Fix the bug when control comments were ignored for grid-area

Author: Filipe W. Lima
Message:
Update examples for Browserslist w/ best practises (#1026)

It came to my attention recently that using [`last 2 versions` may be considered harmful](https://jamie.build/last-2-versions). This specific article uses Babel as an example, but I also remembered that autoprefixer uses Browserlist. I was erroneously thinking that by using `last 2 versions` I would be targetting only most recent browsers, but I learned that it also targets "dead" browsers.

Browserlist's repo [recently added a best practise section](https://github.com/browserslist/browserslist/commit/019cb298c433dcd797d0538df8027fa2b2effc25) mentioning this.

I was thinking it would be a good idea to also update the examples here.

Author: Peter van Westen
Message:
[Refactor] Removes redundant else structures (#889)

* [Refactor] Removes redundant else structures

This one has a bit more refactoring going on, so you will need a good test run n this. Or drop it, if you don't think it is worth it :)

It would clean stuff up a bit to extract a large part of the code in the for loop to a separate getItem method.
That way you can do early returns more easily and only need one result.push(item);

Something like:
``` 
                item = this.getItem(propPrefix, decl);
                result.push(item);
```

* Update value.js

* Update value.js

Author: Richard Wang
Message:
Add hack for unitless 0 basis in IE10/IE11 shorthand flex (#749)

Only applies when there are three components in the flex property.

This is because when there's one or two components only, it's
ambiguous whether whether the first component being a unitless 0 is
intended to be flex-grow or flex-basis. Browsers resolve this by
treating such cases as a flex-grow of 0.

Note with IE11 that even though it understands the unprefixed flex
property, we don't apply the hack there. Instead we let it treat the
unprefixed version as invalid, and fall back onto -ms-flex.

Finally, although some CSS minifiers may revert the 0px to 0, we
don't use 0% instead, even though many of these won't touch 0%.
See https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=495306
for why this is the case.

Workaround for:
https://github.com/philipwalton/flexbugs#4-flex-shorthand-declarations-with-unitless-flex-basis-values-are-ignored

References:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2012/WD-css3-flexbox-20120322/#flexibility
https://www.w3.org/TR/css-flexbox-1/#flex-property
https://www.w3.org/TR/2016/CR-css-values-3-20160929/#component-combinators

Author: Sean Anderson
Message:
Add .json file-ending to all relevant require statements

It's bad practice to implicitly load files by name without specifying
their extension. This fix helps autoprefixer work more easily with
jspm's expectations of how files should be require'd.
